message: لو حد يقدر يساعدني قى الموضوع دا :)
story: Mahmoud El Sharkawy shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: How to change the voice source in a call in android?
caption: stackoverflow.com
description: Is it possible to change the voice source(Mic) with another voice source like a song for example in a call ?! ,um working on an android app in which I want to implement voice changes during a call.

data.message: I'm not sure If you can access the digital data from the mic through the android API in realtime, then feed it back to the API during the call.

I remember years ago that I wanted to encrypt the voice on Android, and the only way was to use VOIP. Basically the mic data goes to internally analog to digital converters, then thru the operating system's driver/API those digital data are then modulated to be transferred by the internal GSM Chips and then sent by the antenna.  Not sure if the latest Android API can give you access to that level.
"Basically the mic data goes to internally analog to digital converters" could i interrupt the process here  and make my changes on the digital converted data ?!

You can record your mic and there are software for that.. the problem is there is no API layer that can let you get your mic digital data and then use it while calling AFAIK. By API I mean something that talks with the driver layer.
